name: methyl_ethyl_sulfide
source: American Petroleum Institute. Research Project 44; Selected Values of Properties of Hydrocarbons and Related Compounds. Texas A & M University; College Station; TX; 1973.
Reason: 1,3-propanedithiol has a melting point of -106.0 degrees Celsius. The basic unit for comparison can be ethanol, which has a melting point of -114.1 degrees Celsius. The introduction of the methyl and ethyl groups reduces the melting point due to the reduced molecular weight and van der Waals interactions. The sulfur atom introduces a rigid structure and potential hydrogen bonding, which might raise the melting point by approximately +10°C.
